intro: Rouliniella unifaria, commonly known as the single-leaf burrweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and unique, spiny fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its leaves are usually simple and alternate, with a rough texture. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its adaptations to arid environments and its role in local ecosystems.
